snippet: The Onagawa plant was closest to the epicenter of last year’s earthquake but was largely undamaged because it was designed with enough safety margins, nuclear inspectors said Friday.
abstract: Japanese nuclear inspectors say the Onagawa power plant was closest to the epicenter of the 2011 earthquake and endured more ground-shaking than the Fukushima plant, but was largely undamaged because it was designed with enough safety margins.
lead_paragraph: The Onagawa plant was closest to the epicenter of last year’s earthquake but was largely undamaged because it was designed with enough safety margins, nuclear inspectors said Friday.

headline.main: Japan: Inspectors Study Plant That Avoided Disaster
headline.print_headline: Japan: Inspectors Study Plant That Avoided Disaster
